item.title: Report X-2024061503
item.description:
Report X-2024061503

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 6X1GALLON ((METAL CANS) SUNNYSIDE DENATURED ALCOHOL WITH A LOOSE CAP CAUSED LEAKAGING ALLOWING 1 OUNCE OF SPILLAGE FROM THE CAN. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report E-2024060593
item.description:
Report E-2024060593

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-22
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted three (3) metal pails and estimated that one (1) ounce of material was released due one (1) damaged 5-gallon metal pail. First Call Environmental personnel containerized the damaged pail and the three (3) impacted pails into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061474
item.description:
Report X-2024061474

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-22
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The box is marked with a corrosive diamond. The box contains 4X1 gal bottles of Noble Low Temp San. The top of the box is wet and ripped from the leaking 1X1 gal bottle of sanitizer. The bottle has a crack along the seam. The other bottles are damaged from the leakage.

(CONTAINS CHROMIC ACID, PHOSPHORIC ACID, AND SULFURIC ACID)8(5.1) PGII spilled on top of a drum. Fernando stated Austin Bowman found the spill and alerted Fernando. Fernando advised the drums ha ve been sitting on the dock for a few day, so he does not know how the spill occurred. Fernando stated SC 134 was closing and asked for CURA to come on Monday morning. The spill is contained and no one will be there over the weekend.

item.description:
Report E-2024060581

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 21, 2024, at 0911 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the release of Zep Zepresto. It was reported that the terminal personnel discovered a release of a total of 1 cup of ZEP ZEPRESTO (UN2922, Corrosive liquids, toxic. n.o.s. (Cresylic Acid Methylene Chloride), 8, 6.1, II) from (2) 20-gallon DM’s due to improper packaging. The release impacted shrink wrap and a pallet. Terminal personnel were able to patch the puncture to the drums, then placed the damaged drums into a 95-gallon overpack DF. Terminal personnel then cleaned the release with the appropriate PPE.

item.description:
Report E-2024060586

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 17, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and adjacent cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged pail in one (1) 30-gallon drum. LSH personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: On June 14, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3264 was punctured and released approximately thirty-five (35) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH deployed absorbents to the impacted trailer and concrete surfaces. All impacted absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite for disposal. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 95-gallon drum.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED WHILE STILL IN A SMALLS BAG FROM THE UNLOAD AND SENT TO THE SMALL SORT. THE DEBAGGER NOTICED THAT IT WAS WET FROM THE INSIDE OUT. HE LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER THEN PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A DMP GREEN BAG. THE EQUIPMENT WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING, IT WAS THEN DETERMINED TO BE AN UNDECLARED PACKAGE. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER: 1ZC1G375YW31120956

  • City: DES MOINES

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 15-gallons of UN3082 "Moccasin II Plus" was released from one (1) 275-gallon tote impacting the trailer floor at the dock door. The caller advised they placed the tote on its side to stop the leak. The tote was punctured by a loading strap in transit. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and dispatched Clean Harbors to assist with clean up. Clean Harbors arrived on site and transferred the remaining material from the damaged tote into a new tote. Clean Harbors deployed oil dri and cleaned the impacted area. The spent oil dri and recovered material was placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060530
item.description:
Report E-2024060530

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NNA experienced a release from a 220-gallon metal tote. The tote was shipped as empty with residual material in it. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 1’ x 6” area of the concrete dock due to a loose valve. The contractors tightened the valve which was re-secured for shipment on. The impacted cardboard and rags were collected into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: LITTLE ROCK

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WHITNEY JOHNSON, 004 OPERATIONS SUPERVISOR, ADVISED SAFETY OF A UN1262, OCTANES SPILL ON THE DOCK FLOOR. WHITNEY STATED LEON VANCE, FORKLIFT OPERATOR, PICKED UP THE SKID TO MOVED IT AND NOTICED IT LEAKING. WHITNEY ADVISED SHE BELIEVES LEON PUNCTURED THE DRUM BUT WASN'T POSITIVE IF HE DID. WHITNEY S TATED LEON THEN PLACED IT IN A TRASH CAN 50 GALLON BARREL WITH TRASH. WHITNEY ADVISED THEY THEN GOT THE DRUM OUT OF THE TRASH CAN AND PLACED WITH THE PUNCTURE RIGHT SIDE UP AND PLACED EPOXY OVER THE HOLE. WHTNEY STATED THE SPILL, 8 FL OZ OF OCTANE EVAPORATED ON THE DOCK FLOOR.~~SAFETY ADVISED WHITNE Y TO PLACE THE TRASH BAG IN THE HAZMAT RECOVERY BIN. SAFETY ALSO ADVISED WHITNEY TO REMIND LEON TO CONTACT SAFETY IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWING A HAZMAT SPILL AND DO NOT TOUCH THE SPILL. CURA SHOULD ALWAYS BE CONTACTED FOR A HAZMAT SPILL.

item.title: Report E-2024060534
item.description:
Report E-2024060534

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-10
  • City: SOUTH POINT
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2-gallons of Sodium Hydroxide Solution (UN1824) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor at door #17. ERTS advised contractor HEPACO would respond due to the corrosive state of the product and amount released. HEPACO advised Oil Dri was applied to the impacted area and the concrete dock was neutralized with a muriatic acid solution. The damaged drum was then placed into a 95-gallon poly drum and the impacted absorbents, pads and PPE were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum for disposal. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 13, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was punctured by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed a degreasing agent and granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor. The crew utilized hand tools to work material into the trailer floor. FCE patched the damaged drum and placed it into one (1) 85-gallon over pack. The crew collected the spent absorbents and debris into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 13, 2024, two (2) 20-gallon fiber drums of UN2014 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN2014-impacted loading dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the two damaged drums were put into two (2) 55-gallon poly vented drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060487
item.description:
Report E-2024060487

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-25T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 13, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of corrosive liquid had a faulty seam and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted areas and placed the damaged drum into a 95-gallon over-pack for disposal. TLE personnel applied granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and asphalt surface and worked them in with hand tools. All corrosive liquid impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 95-gallon drum and one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

All damaged jugs, spent absorbents and absorbent pads were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.   • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to a forklift puncture, 25-gallons of Ultrasil 76 was released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and Lone Star Hazmat Response, LLC was dispatched to assist with clean up. Lone Star Hazmat Response, LLC deployed oil dri and sodium bicarbonate to neutralize the spill. The released product, damaged drum, and oil-dri was placed into an 85-gallon poly drum and 55-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1Z2TT2051331949683, 1Z2TT2051313053522, 1Z2TT2050227616847, 1Z2TT2050225556068, 1Z2TT2050233077632 AND 1Z2TT2050239797657.   • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) quarts of material released from two (2) 5-gallon plastic pails impacting the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the damaged pails and spent cleanup debris into two (2) 20-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060459
item.description:
Report E-2024060459

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: DORAL
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS MIAMI FLORIDA FACILITY, NINE SKIDS MOVING TO COLOMBIA VIA UPS AIR CARGO SERVICE WERE FOUND CONTAINING BOXES WITH COVERED LITHIUM BATTERY MARKS. ALL NINE SKIDS ARE BLACK SHRINK WRAPPED WITHOUT ANY DANGEROUS GOODS INDICATORS ON THE OUTER COVERING. A TOTAL OF 23 BOXES EACH CONTAINING 72 WIRELESS LITHIUM-ION BATTERY POWERED MYJOY COOL EARBUDS WERE FOUND. DURING FORKLIFT MOVEMENT OF THE SKIDS, WE CAN SEE LITHIUM BATTERY MARKS UNDERNEATH ON THE VERY BOTTOM OF THE FREIGHT. THE AIR WAYBILL DOES NOT INDICATE LITHIUM BATTERIES ARE BEING SHIPPED TO COLOMBIA. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY PART OF THE OUTER BLACK SHRINK WRAPPED FREIGHT. EHMA EXPRESS INC, 8509 NW 68TH ST, MIAMI FL 33166 IS THE ISSUING CARRIER'S AGENCY ON THE AIR WAYBILL. SHIPPER'S NAME AND ADDRESS IS SUNRISE FINANCIAL BUSINESS, S.A. C/O FIFO WIRELESS, INC, 10900 NW 21ST STREET SUITE 210, MIAMI FL 33172.

item.title: Report E-2024060431
item.description:
Report E-2024060431

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-15
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SET Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and 5ft-by-14ft area of the asphalt lot and estimated that eight (8) gallons of material was released due to load shift that crushed four boxes containing eight (8) 1-gallon plastic jugs. SET Environmental personnel deployed a neutralizer and then a granular absorbent to the impacted areas. The spent material was gathered and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and the damaged plastic jugs were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USU experienced a UN1760 Captain XTR release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete dock floor due to being crushed by boxes of the same material stacked on top of it. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted areas were then wiped clean. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 13, 2024, one (1) 70-pound battery was punctured and released approximately 1.5-gallons od battery acid to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged batteries were placed into one (1) 30-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024060438

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 11, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1760 had a faulty valve and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Resolute Environmental & Response Services, LLC (RERS) to remediate the site. RERS closed the valve preventing any further leakage. RERS then wiped down all totes and deployed soda ash to the affected areas and swept them in using hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060436
item.description:
Report E-2024060436

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 11, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon pails of UN3264 were crushed in transit and released approximately 2.5-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. ER discovered that R+L personnel had placed four damaged drums into one (1) 15-gallon drum. ER personnel utilized a neutralizing agent to remediate the trailer. Granular absorbents were then placed on the impacted areas and swept using hand tools. ER then broke down the impacted pallet completing remediation. All spent absorbents as well as the pallet were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: While parked at a truck stop, the Veolia driver noticed a leak coming from the front of the trailer. The driver notified Veolia management personnel and applied oil dry to the material that released to the ground. Veolia employees investigated the spill and discovered the container had tipped over while in transportation and leaked from the drum closure. The spill was remediated, the drum was closed properly and the load was properly secured for continued transportation without any further incident.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: NS personnel inside Brosnan Yard (Macon, GA) reported a Chlorine release from an unidentified car. A personnel reported a strong smell of Chlorine while walking the line of tank cars. Upon inspection by a contractor, it was noted that tank car OLNX 711120 was the car that was leaking. A strong smell of chlorine was noted, audible hissing was found, degradation to the paint in the protective housing was noted. The source of the leak was found to be the Tell-Tale valve on the PRD. The valve was open. The tell-tale valve was closed and the leak stopped. The tell-tale valve leaking also indicates the rupture disc under the PRD was not intact.

A Contractor contained and clean-up the release using oil dry. The four damaged jugs were overpacked into one 55-gallon DF for waste disposal along with the impacted oil dry. No storm drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

  • City: DES PLAINES

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDP experienced a UN1760 Step Down Low Odor Finish Liquidator release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to a load shift, causing the pallet to tip over. The impacted area was cleaned and neutralized with citric acid solution, baking soda, and absorbents. The damaged pail and all impacted cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining pails in the shipment were re-stacked and secured for continued transit. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

The jugs were poured into (3) 55-gallon poly drums to be disposed of as pure liquids. The jugs were then rinsed, and all rinse water was placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. item.title: Report E-2024060426
item.description:
Report E-2024060426

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSL experienced a UN2922 Santoflex 44PF release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 55-gallons of product released to a 20’ x 8' area of the trailer floor & a 30' x 10' area of the asphalt lot below due to a forklift puncture. The impacted areas were cleaned with a neutral soap solution and absorbents. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. The impacted absorbents, cut up impacted pallets, and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into (13) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: A HAZMAT AUDITOR BROUGHT TRAM BY AND SAID THEY HAD A HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS THAT THEY THOUGHT MAY BE LEAKING AS THERE WAS A STONG CHEMICAL SMELL COMING FROM THE PACKAG. RESPONDER OPENED UP THE PACKAGE AND FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS AND THE INSIDE CARDBOARD TO BE WET. FURTHER INSPECTION SHOWED 1 OF THE CONTAINERS HAD A VERY LOOSE CAP THAT HAD ALLOWED THE CONTENTS OF THE CONTAINER TO LEAK OUT.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Car was found to be leaking during movement and was set out to the Rip track. Upon inspection it was determined that the rupture disc was blown, and the cover/cap was missing. The cable connecting the cover/cap to the trivent assembly was frayed. The disc gave evidence of a surge that ruptured the disc in an outward direction. I was unable to determine if a surge protector was present. The disc was replaced, and the shipper was advised to get an MRU to replace the cover/cap and have the car requalified.

item.title: Report E-2024060428
item.description:
Report E-2024060428

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: ELK GROVE VILLAGE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6in-by-200ft area of the concrete roadway and a 53’-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that thirty (30) gallons of material was released due to load shift that resulted in a puncture to one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The trailer was offloaded to locate the damaged container. Hepaco personnel deployed a neutralizer and then used granular absorbents and pads to gather the released material. The impacted pallets were broken down and placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums. Various cleanup debris and spent absorbents were gathered and placed into four (4) additional 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged drum was over packed into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum still containing approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of product. The generated waste was left at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060417
item.description:
Report E-2024060417

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 7, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon can of UN2922 was damaged in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized poly sheeting, drums and liners, cleaners and absorbent pads, plug and patch kit, additional pallets, and hand tools to remediate the sulfuric acid-impacted impacted dock floor. TLE personnel solidified and neutralized the damaged pail of product. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon vented poly drums to be staged onsite.

  • City: NEENAH

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 7, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was punctured in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Valley Environmental Response (VER) to remediate the impacted site. VER deployed neutralizers to the trailer floor, surrounding cargo and collected one (1) 5-gallon plastic pail into one (1) 55-gallon double lined poly drum. VER utilized absorbent pads and neutralizer to the impacted cargo. VER neutralized the wooden pallet, deconstructed it with hand tools, and placed it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Crews utilized hand tools to collect all spent absorbent pads, neutralizers, and containerized it into the same one (1) 55-gallon poly drum as the deconstructed pallet. VER staged onsite the two (2) 55-gallon poly drums of waste for further handling

  • Description: On June 7, 2024, four (4) one-gallon jugs of UN3149 were punctured by a nail and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and adjacent cardboard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE personnel collected the damaged jugs, and impacted cardboard box, for disposal. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the UN3149-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All UN3149 impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) vented 55-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060425
item.description:
Report E-2024060425

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-01
  • City: NEW HARTFORD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5100
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE SHIPPING FROM NEW HARTFORD, NY TO SYRACUSE, NY BROKE OPEN REQUIRING A PACKAGE REWRAP. UPON INSPECTION A MC LEOD GAGE DEVICE CONTAINING MERCURY HAD BROKEN. AN OUTSIDE RESPONSE TEAM WAS CONTACTED. THE OUTSIDE RESPONDER CONTAINED, CLEANED, AND REMOVED THE PACKAGE AND CONTENTS FROM THE FACILITY. NO EVACUATION OF THE FACILITY WAS NEEDED AND NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED. THE OUTSIDE RESPONDER ADVISED AN ESTIMATED FIVE POUNDS OF MERCURY WAS CONTAINED IN THE MC LEOD GAGE DEVICE WITH APPROXIMATELY 30 ML (1 OZ) OF MERCURY RELEASING. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS OFFERED FOR AIR SERVICE BUT ONLY MOVED IN THE GROUND NETWORK PRIOR TO THE LEAKAGE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • City: EAGLE PASS

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1544
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UTLX 208792 had a slow drip of diesel from the BOV cap. After inspecting found the BOV had a disengaging bottom outlet handle. The handle was disengaged and secured with the BOV not completely closed and securement pin hanging from chain. Outlet cap was found slightly tool tight but able to be easily turned with wrench. Bottom outlet cap was removed, and cap gasket inspected found to be in good condition. No product dripping from the BOV after completely closing the valve BO/cap reinstalled, and tool tightened.

  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 05/20/2024, at 1716 hours, personnel in the CSXT Toledo Docks Lakefront Yard, discovered GATX6902, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and Chemtrade, NRC, Ohio EPA were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2024-05-20-00193). EnviroServe, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the liquid line closure cap was less then tool tight and could be turned by hand several times. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative (Mark Logan, 236-885-2466). Contractor personnel secured the cap and decontaminated the car.

item.title: Report I-2024060026
item.description:
Report I-2024060026

  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN WELDING & GAS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver finished C02 customer fill process. While fill hose was being retracted on hose reel, it unexpectedly contacted the vapor ball valve and it inadvertently opened causing Carbon Dioxide to vent out of the delivery vehicle. Driver could not visually locate vapor ball valve due to carbon dioxide cloud. Driver's supervisor instructed driver to move vehicle to open area so cloud could dissipate. Local fire department was contacted by witness. Fire department showed up on scene and assisted with closing vapor ball valve which stopped the uncontrolled release of carbon dioxide. The total event took approximately 40 minutes.

item.title: Report I-2024060016
item.description:
Report I-2024060016

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-06
  • City: Kansas City
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On 5/6/2024 CPKC Hazmat received notice that a loaded liquid Argon car, MTGX 7050, was observed Ieaking during an inbound train inspection at the Kansas City, MO Knoche yard, and had an iced cabinet. CPKC Hazmat mobilized to the yard along with a railroad qualified response contractor to assist with mitigating the release. Upon arrival, responders found MTGX 7050 to be 85-90% empty. Also, the car needed to be switched into a track where it could be safely secured. Temporary measures were taken to stop the leak utilizing a freeze patch. Hazmat requested the car be isolated in a suitable track for further action. During switching to isolation, the freeze patch failed and after being isolated, the car finished depressurizing. Responders determined the source of the leak was a broken Liquid Sample Valve Feedline(V-13R) in right cabinet, and a loose fitting in the left cabinet on the PB Vapor Recovery Isolation/Check pipe fitting(RCV-1). The total estimated release is 15,336 gallons of liquid Argon(total load loss). The car was on hazmat hold until an OTMA-1 was obtained to move the car to home shop. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.

item.title: Report I-2024060018
item.description:
Report I-2024060018

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-02
  • City: ALBANY
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TEAM TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Tank truck was being loaded with 45,000 lbs of formaldehyde solution, Toward end of loading, a high level probe should have stopped the pump and prevented overfilling of the tank. When overfilling occurred, the driver recognized it almost immediately and shut down the pump manually. Spilled formaldehyde solution flowed down the side of the truck on to the truck loading pad, and then toward secondary containment ditch to the east of. the pad. The truck and loading pad were washed down with water into the containment ditch where it drained into a sump and was conveyed by in-place submersible pump to a recycle storage tank. Spilage was estimated at 20-to-30 gallons. Investigation found that high level probe was set to trigger 10-seconds after contact w/ solution. It should have been set for a 1-second response
